intention: Keith wants to go to the movie with the girls he met.
immoral_action: Keith takes his car and drives with the girls to the movie theater without informing Jim.
immoral_consequence: Jim wanders around the beach looking for Keith, gets sunburned, and has to walk home.

norm: You shouldn't steal your coworkers food.
situation: Ivan is at the work cafeteria with both their food on the table while his coworker Liam is getting a drink.
intention: Ivan wants to take a bite of the food.
moral_action: Ivan reaches for his own plate and grabs a little bite of food from it.
moral_consequence: Liam sees Ivan eating his own food and rushes back to join him.

norm: You shouldn't steal your coworkers food.

intention: Ivan wants to take a bite of the food.
immoral_action: Ivan reaches over into Ivan's plate and grabs a bite of a piece of his food.
immoral_consequence: Liam sees Ivan eating food from his plate and is livid that Ivan is spreading his germs on his plate.

norm: It's wrong to brag about how much money you make.

immoral_consequence: Debbie's friends will think she is arrogant and want to avoid talking to her.

norm: It's wrong not to want to earn money.
situation: Dave is at school watching a guidance counselor do a presentation on different career types when she asks Dave what he wants to be when he grows up.
intention: Dave wants to answer the question.
moral_action: Dave tells the guidance counselor that he wants to be a computer tech like his dad is.
moral_consequence: The guidance counselor thinks Dave is quite bright, and she's happy to see he's thought about his future.

norm: It's wrong not to want to earn money.

intention: Dave wants to answer the question.

norm: It's wrong to judge entire groups

immoral_consequence: "James is angry that Dennis is talking about stereotypical black things and assuming that James must play basketball like ""all"" black people."

norm: It is wrong to embarrass someone at work.

intention: Craig wants to state a fact about Nancy.

norm: It's wasteful to throw away a new piece of clothing.

norm: You shouldn't expect your family to resolve your transportation difficulties.

intention: John wants to give Jill a compliment.
moral_action: John walks over to Jill and tells her he likes the color of her shirt.
moral_consequence: Jill is flattered and compliments John on his clothing as well.

norm: It's wrong to sexually harass people.
situation: John sees his co-worker Jill standing at the water cooler.
intention: John wants to give Jill a compliment.
immoral_action: John walks over to Jill and says the shirt she is wearing make her breasts look good.
immoral_consequence: Jill is offended and files a complaint against John with human resources.

norm: It's bad to want a job where you hurt others.
situation: Bill is looking through a careers page online as he's in need of a new job.
intention: Bill wants to decide which job to apply to.
moral_action: Bill decides to apply for a job in a government office where he would process paperwork.
moral_consequence: Bill finds that the job requires him to do little for a lot of money, and he spends his days happy at work.

norm: It's bad to want a job where you hurt others.
situation: Bill is looking through a careers page online as he's in need of a new job.
intention: Bill wants to decide which job to apply to.
immoral_action: Bill decides to apply for the job of a bodyguard for a rich man and his family.
immoral_consequence: Bill finds that the job requires him to kill those who attempt to harm his clients and it eventually wears on his conscience.

norm: It's good to purchase things that you enjoy
situation: Allison has been bored lately and is interested in learning an instrument.
intention: Allison wants to buy music equipment.
moral_action: Allison decides on a guitar, which is her favorite instrument, and places the order.
moral_consequence: Allison is in love with the sound and has motivation to practice daily.

norm: It's good to purchase things that you enjoy
situation: Allison has been bored lately and is interested in learning an instrument.
intention: Allison wants to buy music equipment.
immoral_action: Allison see's a deal on a banjo, which isn't her favorite instrument, but she buys it regardless.
immoral_consequence: Allison hates the way it sounds and isn't motivated to learn.

norm: You shouldn't let people fall if you can prevent it.
situation: James is hired to be a bodyguard at a stage show with a high stage.
intention: James wants to work the entire night for the show.
moral_action: James works the entire night by watching to see if anyone falls off the stage.
moral_consequence: The performers feel safe with James there and James feels accomplished.

norm: You shouldn't let people fall if you can prevent it.
situation: James is hired to be a bodyguard at a stage show with a high stage.
intention: James wants to work the entire night for the show.
immoral_action: James works the night but doesn't pay attention if people are about to fall off the stage.
immoral_consequence: James is criticized by management for negligence and James feels humiliated.

norm: It's good to be affectionate to your spouse.
situation: Gordon is about to go to bed and his wife is still staying to watch the end of her TV show.
intention: Gordon wants to say goodnight to his wife.
moral_action: Gordon tells his wife goodnight and gives her a soft kiss on the forehead before going upstairs.
moral_consequence: Gordon's wife is filled with warmth from the sweet kiss and is happy her husband shows her love.

norm: It's good to be affectionate to your spouse.
situation: Gordon is about to go to bed and his wife is still staying to watch the end of her TV show.
intention: Gordon wants to say goodnight to his wife.
immoral_action: Gordon tells his wife goodnight and walks upstairs to go to the bedroom.
immoral_consequence: Gordon's wife feels like Gordon is cold and maybe there's a problem in their marriage.

norm: Looking at someone's chest can be offensive.
situation: Dave's coworker, who has large breasts, starts talking to him about something work related.
intention: Dave wants to look at his coworker as they are talking to him.
moral_action: Dave looks his coworker in the eyes in a normal manner while they are talking to him.
moral_consequence: Dave's coworker sees Dave as a normal decent person and feels comfortable around him.

norm: Looking at someone's chest can be offensive.
situation: Dave's coworker, who has large breasts, starts talking to him about something work related.
intention: Dave wants to look at his coworker as they are talking to him.
immoral_action: Dave looks down at his coworker's chest for most of the time they are talking to him.
immoral_consequence: Dave's coworker thinks he is some kind of creep for just staring at her breasts while she was talking to him.

norm: It's unhealthy to want to make somebody jealous
situation: Joy is looking to buy new heels, but she's deciding between an expensive one and a budget one.
intention: Joy wants to buy new heels.
moral_action: Joy buys the budget heels because she thinks the expensive ones would be a waste of money.
moral_consequence: Joy's friends respect that Joy is being modest with her heels.

norm: It's unhealthy to want to make somebody jealous
situation: Joy is looking to buy new heels, but she's deciding between an expensive one and a budget one.
intention: Joy wants to buy new heels.
immoral_action: Joy buys the expensive heels because she thinks they will impress others.
immoral_consequence: Joy's friends become jealous of Joy, and they don't like that she's trying to show off.

norm: It is good to treat your teachers respectfully
situation: Chris is feeling bored while his teacher is giving a lecture and thinks about just chatting with his friend.
intention: Chris wants to consider chatting with his friend.
moral_action: Chris resists the temptation of chatting with his friend and pushes himself to focus on the lecture.
moral_consequence: Chris manages to follow along with the lecture and the teacher experiences no problems giving the lecture.

norm: It is good to treat your teachers respectfully
situation: Chris is feeling bored while his teacher is giving a lecture and thinks about just chatting with his friend.
intention: Chris wants to consider chatting with his friend.
immoral_action: Chris decides to just chat with his friend instead of listening to the lecture.
immoral_consequence: The teacher finds Chris' chatter disruptive and disrespectful, so he tells Chris to leave the classroom.

norm: You shouldn't pressure your partner to have sex with you.
situation: Bobby has been dating Amber for a few months, but they have not had sex yet.
intention: Bobby wants to talk about when they should have sex.
moral_action: Bobby tells Amber that they should have sex whenever she feels ready.
moral_consequence: Amber will feel that Bobby cares about how she feels.

norm: You shouldn't pressure your partner to have sex with you.
situation: Bobby has been dating Amber for a few months, but they have not had sex yet.
intention: Bobby wants to talk about when they should have sex.
immoral_action: Bobby tells Amber that she should have sex with him soon, or he'll break up with her.
immoral_consequence: Amber will feel that Bobby is pushy and not considerate of how she feels.

norm: It's wrong to try to take someone's belonging from them.
situation: Sally was sitting on a bench waiting for the bus when she sees a woman forget her purse when she gets up to board the bus.
intention: Sally wants to return the purse.
moral_action: Sally picks up the purse and hurries to bring it to the woman before she leaves.
moral_consequence: The woman is grateful and gives Sally five dollars for helping her.

norm: It's wrong to try to take someone's belonging from them.
situation: Sally was sitting on a bench waiting for the bus when she sees a woman forget her purse when she gets up to board the bus.
intention: Sally wants to return the purse.
immoral_action: Sally picks up the purse and takes the money from it before returning it to the woman.
immoral_consequence: The woman realizes that the money is missing and reports Sally to the authorities.

norm: It's bad to have sex in public.
situation: Mark and Marcia are in love and at the crowded beach together during the day.
intention: Mark wants to make love to his girlfriend Marcia.
moral_action: Mark takes Marcia to his beachhouse and has sex with her there.
moral_consequence: The other beachgoers are comfortable and Mark and Marcia stay out of jail.

norm: It's bad to have sex in public.
situation: Mark and Marcia are in love and at the crowded beach together during the day.
intention: Mark wants to make love to his girlfriend Marcia.
immoral_action: Mark starts with Marcia on the crowded beach and has sex with her in front of others.
immoral_consequence: Other beachgoers become uncomfortable and the cops come and arrest them.

norm: It's wrong not to think about others personal space.
situation: Kevin works at a fast food restaurant that delivers food to its customers and an order is up to be delivered.
intention: Kevin wants to give the food to the customer.
moral_action: Kevin places the food on the table, extends his arm, and hands the customer his receipt.
moral_consequence: The customer gladly takes the receipt and thanks Kevin for the food, feeling comfortable the whole time.

norm: It's wrong not to think about others personal space.
situation: Kevin works at a fast food restaurant that delivers food to its customers and an order is up to be delivered.
intention: Kevin wants to give the food to the customer.
immoral_action: Kevin places the food on the customer's table, comes shoulder-to-shoulder to him, and shows him the bill.
immoral_consequence: The customer gets uncomfortable and tells Kevin to back off or else.

norm: It is not okay to lie about things.
situation: Chad had broken the vase in his mother's house playing catch with his brother.
intention: Chad wants to tell his mother that the vase is broken.
moral_action: Chad tells his mother that the vase is broken and that it's partially his fault.
moral_consequence: Chad's mother is somewhat upset, but she tells Chad she is proud of him for telling the truth.

norm: It is not okay to lie about things.
situation: Chad had broken the vase in his mother's house playing catch with his brother.
intention: Chad wants to tell his mother that the vase is broken.
immoral_action: Chad tells his mother that the vase was knocked down by the dog running through the room.
immoral_consequence: Chad's mother finds out what really happened, and she grounds him for a week.

norm: It's frowned upon to back out of an agreement.
situation: Robert just agreed with his regular plumber about a big repair job at his house when he discovers that another plumber would charge him less.
intention: Robert wants to save money.
moral_action: Robert discusses the situation with his regular plumber, and they agree on a lower price.
moral_consequence: Robert's regular plumber's schedule goes as planned and his employees work their regular hours.

norm: It's frowned upon to back out of an agreement.
situation: Robert just agreed with his regular plumber about a big repair job at his house when he discovers that another plumber would charge him less.
intention: Robert wants to save money.
immoral_action: Robert cancels the job with his regular plumber without explanation and hires the less expensive one instead.
immoral_consequence: Robert's regular plumber has to reorganize his schedule and decrease some of his employees' hours.

norm: It is wrong to discriminate against a language.
situation: Joe has to take a foreign language class, and his college counselor Irene suggests that he take Chinese.
intention: Joe wants to take a foreign language class.
moral_action: Joe tells Irene that he would love to take Chinese.
moral_consequence: Irene helps Joe sign up for the Chinese language class.

norm: It is wrong to discriminate against a language.
situation: Joe has to take a foreign language class, and his college counselor Irene suggests that he take Chinese.
intention: Joe wants to take a foreign language class.
immoral_action: Joe tells Irene that he would rather take Spanish because the Chinese language sounds terrible to him.
immoral_consequence: Irene chastises Joe for speaking ill of an entire language.

norm: It's rude to promise something and fail to deliver.
situation: Cam gets a call from his friend Adam who asks to come pick up the lawnmower Cam promised he could borrow.
intention: Cam wants to tell Adam not to come over.
moral_action: Cam tells Adam not to come over, that he'll bring the mower over to him right away.
moral_consequence: Adam is delighted because not only will he get the mower but Cam will deliver it, too.

norm: It's rude to promise something and fail to deliver.
situation: Cam gets a call from his friend Adam who asks to come pick up the lawnmower Cam promised he could borrow.
intention: Cam wants to tell Adam not to come over.
immoral_action: Cam tells Adam not to come over because he changed his mind and hangs up the phone.
immoral_consequence: Adam is livid that Cam could so flippantly just renege on his promise like that and be so abrupt.

norm: You shouldn't let your partner nag you.
situation: Dana told her boyfriend Paul that she would wash the dishes at night, but he keeps telling her to do them during the day.
intention: Dana wants to respond to Paul.
moral_action: Dana tells Paul to stop bothering her as she said she will do the dishes at night.
moral_consequence: Paul will learn that he cannot bother Dana into doing things when he wants.

norm: You shouldn't let your partner nag you.
situation: Dana told her boyfriend Paul that she would wash the dishes at night, but he keeps telling her to do them during the day.
intention: Dana wants to respond to Paul.
immoral_action: Dana tells Paul she will do the dishes during the day.
immoral_consequence: Paul will think he can get Dana to do what he wants if he keeps repeating what he wants.

norm: You should plan group trips with everyone involved.
situation: Connor is taking his wife and three kids on a vacation, they're driving cross country to visit relatives.
intention: Connor wants to have an enjoyable trip.
moral_action: Connor plans out the route in advance, taking suggestions from his wife and kids for activity stops.
moral_consequence: Everyone in the car gets to do some activities that they like, and it's a very enjoyable trip for everyone.

norm: You should plan group trips with everyone involved.
situation: Connor is taking his wife and three kids on a vacation, they're driving cross country to visit relatives.
intention: Connor wants to have an enjoyable trip.
immoral_action: Connor plans out the route in advance, including activity stops, without consulting his family.
immoral_consequence: Connor's route and activities are of interest to him and his wife, but the kids are bored and whine a lot.

norm: It's frowned upon to get an F on an assignment.
situation: Ginny has a big test at school tomorrow that she hasn't studied for yet, but she wants to go out to play.
intention: Ginny wants show up for the exam.
moral_action: Ginny decides to have a cram study session instead of playing, then takes the test.
moral_consequence: Ginny gets a passing grade and learns next time to study earlier.

norm: It's frowned upon to get an F on an assignment.
situation: Ginny has a big test at school tomorrow that she hasn't studied for yet, but she wants to go out to play.
intention: Ginny wants show up for the exam.
immoral_action: Ginny decides to not go over her notes and plays outside instead, and then takes the test.
immoral_consequence: Ginny ends up failing the exam and regrets not studying.
